\vspace{13pt}
\textbf{Research Interests}\\
\rule[0.5ex]{1\linewidth}{1pt}

\vspace{-8pt}

My research focuses on increasing the efficiency of numerical techniques
for simulating reacting flows using supercomputers. I am focused on
producing and developing methods that help to reduce the computational
cost involved in these simulations. Following this objective, I worked
on projects in different areas involving: Low-Mach-number flows, Pressure
Projection Methods, Modified Equations, Machine Learning, Computational
Fluid Dynamics, Simulation Science, Parallel Computing.

\rule[0.5ex]{1\linewidth}{1pt}

\end{itemize}
\item [{2013\textendash 17}] Bachelor in Mechanical Engineering / Notre

\begin{itemize}
\item Graduated with a GPA of 3.89, Highest distinction.
\item Dean\textquoteright s List for all semesters
\item Scholarship: 75\% Scholarship, all semesters
\end{itemize}
\end{lyxlist}

\textbf{Publications}\\
\rule[0.5ex]{1\linewidth}{1pt}

\vspace{-8pt}

\begin{lyxlist}{00.00.0000}
\item [{2020}] \textbf{Mokbel Karam,} James C. Sutherland, and Tony Saad,
\textquotedbl PyModPDE: A python software for modified equation analysis\textquotedbl ,
2020, SoftwareX (Volume 12, 100541).
\item [{2019}] \textbf{Mokbel Karam, }Tony Saad, Michael Hansen, and James
C. Sutherland, ``A Framework for Analyzing the Temporal Accuracy
of Pressure Projection Methods'', 2019 AIAA Computational Fluid Dynamics
Conference, AIAA Aviation Forum, (AIAA 2019-3634).
\item [{2018}] Tony Saad, \textbf{Mokbel Karam}, and James C. Sutherland,
\textquotedbl An Explicit Variable-Density Projection Method for
Low-Mach Reacting Flows on Structured Uniform Grids\textquotedbl ,
2018 Fluid Dynamics Conference, AIAA Aviation Forum, (AIAA 2018-4266).
\end{lyxlist}
\textbf{Presentations}\\
\rule[0.5ex]{1\linewidth}{1pt}

\vspace{-8pt}

\begin{lyxlist}{00.00.0000}
\item [{2019}] \textbf{Mokbel Karam, }Tony Saad ``Efficient Runge-Kutta
Methods for Incompressible Flow'', 2019 Graduate Symposium, Chemical
Engineering Department, The University of Utah.
\item [{2019}] \textbf{Mokbel Karam, }Tony Saad ``On a Class of High-Order,
Low-Cost Time Integrators for the Navier-Stokes Equations'', 2019
Rocky Mountain Fluid Mechanics (RMFM) Research Symposium, CU Boulder.
\item [{2019}] \textbf{Mokbel Karam, }Tony Saad, Michael Hansen, and James
C. Sutherland, ``A Framework for Analyzing the Temporal Accuracy
of Pressure Projection Methods'', 2019 AIAA Computational Fluid Dynamics
Conference, AIAA Aviation Forum, (AIAA 2019-3634).
\item [{2019}] \textbf{Mokbel Karam, }Tony Saad, and James C. Sutherland,
``Efficient Multistage Time Integrators for Incompressible Flows
Using Projection Methods'', SIAM Conference on Computational Science
and Engineering.
\item [{2019}] \textbf{Mokbel Karam}, Fady Najjar, Ming Jiang, James Sutherland,
and Tony Saad. ``Exploring the Predictability of Random Forests \&
Deep Neural Networks for the Sedov-Von Neumann-Taylor Blast Wave Solution'',
SIAM Conference on Computational Science and Engineering. 
\item [{2018}] Tony Saad, \textbf{Mokbel Karam}, and James C. Sutherland,
\textquotedbl An Explicit Variable-Density Projection Method for
Low-Mach Reacting Flows on Structured Uniform Grids\textquotedbl ,
2018 Fluid Dynamics Conference, AIAA Aviation Forum, (AIAA 2018-4266)
\item [{2018}] \textbf{Mokbel Karam}, Fady Najjar, Ming Jiang, James Sutherland,
and Tony Saad. ``Applying Machine Learning to the Sedov-von Neumann-Taylor
Blast Wave'', 2018 Rocky Mountain Fluid Mechanics (RMFM) Research
Symposium, CU Boulder.
\item [{2018}] \textbf{Mokbel Karam}, Fady Najjar, Ming Jiang, James Sutherland,
and Tony Saad. ``Applying Machine Learning to the Sedov-von Neumann-Taylor
Blast Wave'', Seminar, Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory.
\end{lyxlist}
